brief.content-text:
The diagram depicts router, R1, connected to network 10.1.0.0 via port F A 0 /0. R1 is also connected via S0/0/0 to S0/0/0 port of R2 on network 10.2.0.0. R2 is connected via S0/0/1 to router the S0/0/1 port of R3 on network 10.3.0.0. R3 is connected via F A 0 /0 to network 10.4.0.0.

R1 Routing Table
C10.1.0.0 /24F A 0 /0
C10.2.0.0 /24 S0/0/0
D10.3.0.0 /24S0/0/0
D10.4.0.0 /24S0/0/0

R2 Routing Table
D10.1.0.0 /24S0/0/0
C10.2.0.0 /24S0/0/0
C10.3.0.0 /24S0/0/1
D10.4.0.0 /24S0/0/1

R3 Routing Table
D10.1.0.0 /24S0/0/1
D10.2.0.0 /24S0/0/1
C10.3.0.0 /24S0/0/1
C10.4.0.0 /24F A 0 /0

EIGRP sends a bounded update to alert neighbors that 10.1.0.0 is down. Hello packets continue to maintain neighbor relationships.
